contentrichtext.text: '''Gregory Fortuin''' was born in [[South Africa]] and has had business and political experience there and in [[Australia]] and [[New Zealand]]. In 1998 he was appointed by [[Nelson Mandela]] as Honorary Consul to New Zealand. From April 2001 to October 2002 he was New Zealand's [[Race Relations Conciliator]]. He has been praised by [[Jim Bolger]], former National Party Prime Minister, and [[Ken Douglas]], former president of the [[New Zealand Council of Trade Unions]].
